Hey Speedy, glad to see these parts updated for 1.0. One of the new features is the ability to filter by cross-section, and Filter Extensions allows us to provide icons and display names for custom cross-sections. I see you've set up your hex trusses to be sorted under size 2, but I'm happy to whip up a config and icon to sort them under a custom "hextruss" cross-section if you're interested.

(EDIT: Also, the docking port and Ultra Hub are listed in the "surface-attach" category when they aren't surface-attachable, and the small adapter should have size1 in its bulkheadProfiles.)

It's not for the drag profile (that's handled by crunching on the model itself and doing some approximations), but for sorting in the VAB.

Here's the config I used -- it moves them to the "hextruss" bulkhead profile only when Filter Extension is installed, so parts don't get moved into a non-stock category unless the system to support it is there. (I'd hold off on releasing this until my icons are in the main Filter Extension branch.)


@PART[HexTrussSml,HexTrussSAS,HexTrussMed,HexTrussLongTank,HexTrussLongWater,HexTrussLongHollowWide,HexTrussLongHollow,HexTrussLong,HexTrussEndCap,HexTrussSmlWalled]:NEEDS[FilterExtensions]
{
    @bulkheadProfiles ^= :size2:hextruss
}

@PART[HexTrussDockingPort]:NEEDS[FilterExtensions]
{
    @bulkheadProfiles = hextruss
}

@PART[HexTrussHub01]:NEEDS[FilterExtensions]
{
    @bulkheadProfiles = size2,hextruss
}

@PART[HexTrussAdapterLarge]:NEEDS[FilterExtensions]
{
    @bulkheadProfiles = size2,srf,hextruss
}

@PART[HexTrussAdapterSmall]:NEEDS[FilterExtensions]
{
    @bulkheadProfiles = size1,srf,hextruss
}
